title: Aluminum Rises to 3-Year High Amid Tight Supply
summary: Aluminum prices have surged to a three-year high, reaching $2,809.80 per tonne, driven by tight supply conditions and strong demand from clean energy sectors. China's aluminum output cap and power shortages have limited smelting output, contributing to the price increase. The market expects prices to continue rising due to ongoing supply constraints.

title: SMM Flash News: Domestic Secondary Aluminum Ingot Inventory Falls
summary: Domestic secondary aluminum ingot inventory has decreased, supported by rising raw material prices. This trend reflects the ongoing dynamics in the aluminum market, where supply and demand imbalances continue to influence prices. The decrease in inventory suggests a tightening market.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum prices have reached a three-year high due to rising demand from clean energy sectors, including electric vehicles and renewable power. The metal's recyclability and strength make it crucial for these applications. However, the industry faces challenges in reducing its carbon footprint.

title: NioCorp and IBC Advanced Alloys Successfully Cast Aluminum-Scandium Alloy for Potential Expansion into Al-Sc Alloy Parts
summary: NioCorp and IBC Advanced Alloys announced the successful commercial production of a 0.2% aluminum-scandium (Al-Sc) alloy at IBC's foundry in Franklin, Indiana. The alloy met target purity and specifications, supporting further processing for cast, forged, extruded, and additive-manufactured parts. This development advances potential scandium applications in aerospace, automotive, electronics, and defense, with Elk Creek project aiming to produce about 100 tonnes/year of scandium oxide subject to financing.

title: Hillside Aluminium maintains steady output at 181,000 tonnes in Q3
summary: South Africa’s Hillside Aluminium smelter produced 181,000 tonnes of aluminum in Q3 FY 2025, a slight increase from previous quarters. The smelter operates 864 electrolysis cells using the Pechiney AP30 Hall-Héroult process, enabling stable output despite high input costs and power interruptions. Management reaffirmed a production goal of 720,000 tonnes for the 2026 financial year, reflecting confidence in the plant's performance.

title: Alcoa sees tariff costs on aluminum shipments continuing to rise
summary: Alcoa Corp. reported that US import tariffs on Canadian aluminum cost the company $69 million more in Q3 2025 compared to the previous quarter, with further increases expected in Q4. The tariffs, set initially by the Trump administration, continue to impact the aluminum industry significantly. Alcoa also faced additional costs related to restart issues at its San Ciprián smelter in Spain and lower third-party energy sales.

title: Kaiser Aluminum Corporation Reports Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results
summary: Kaiser Aluminum Corporation announced Q3 2025 financial results with net sales of $844 million and net income of $40 million, up significantly from the previous year. The company serves aerospace, automotive, packaging, and general engineering markets with semi-fabricated specialty aluminum products. Kaiser raised its full-year 2025 adjusted EBITDA outlook, reflecting strong operational performance.

title: 2Q 2025 Cost Report: As Steel, Aluminum Tariffs Rise to 50%, Feds OK US Steel Sale to Nippon Steel
summary: The US increased tariffs on steel and aluminum imports to 50%, aiming to protect domestic producers amid global overcapacity led by China. The American Iron and Steel Institute welcomed the tariff hike, which is expected to curb surges of Chinese exports. The report also notes potential restarts of idled US steel production capacity, which could influence aluminum and steel market prices.

title: UAE Delivers First Batch of Low-Carbon Aluminium Powered by Nuclear Energy from Barakah
summary: Emirates Global Aluminium and Emirates Nuclear Energy Company have delivered the UAE's first batch of low-carbon aluminium produced using clean electricity from the Barakah Nuclear Energy Plant. This product, branded MinimAL, represents a significant step in industrial sustainability by using nuclear power to decarbonize aluminium production, with the aluminium supplied to Egypt's CANEX Aluminum.

title: The more sustainability and transparency, the better the decisions
summary: Speira has ceased primary aluminium production to focus entirely on recycling, aiming to reduce energy use and CO2 emissions by up to 95% compared to primary production. The company invests in advanced recycling technologies to close material loops and improve circularity, especially recycling beverage cans multiple times a year to maximize sustainability benefits.

title: Recycled aluminium for sustainable shipbuilding
summary: Speira's recycled aluminium alloy, VIA Maris, offers a sustainable and mechanically superior material for the maritime industry, including yacht builder Arksen's hybrid propulsion vessels. This marine-grade aluminium helps reduce environmental impact while maintaining high performance, supporting the industry's shift toward sustainability.

title: NioCorp and IBC Advanced Alloys Successfully Cast Aluminum-Scandium Alloy for Potential Expansion into Al-Sc Alloy Parts
summary: NioCorp and IBC Advanced Alloys announced the successful commercial production of a 0.2% aluminum-scandium alloy, meeting purity and specification targets. This advancement supports future applications in aerospace, automotive, electronics, and defense, with plans to produce up to 100 tonnes/year of scandium oxide pending project financing.

title: The future of US aluminium hinges on energy, not tariff policy - here's why
summary: US aluminium production revival depends primarily on affordable electricity rather than tariff policies. The energy-intensive nature of aluminium smelting requires long-term contracts at competitive rates, which are currently higher in the US compared to hydro-rich Canada, posing a challenge to domestic aluminium sustainability and competitiveness.

title: AL Circle x Takuo Harato: Advancing sustainability and innovation in the global aluminium industry
summary: Takuo Harato discusses challenges and progress in aluminium sustainability, focusing on energy efficiency in refining and the industry's transition toward greener practices. The conversation highlights ongoing innovation efforts to reduce environmental impacts in aluminium production globally.

title: Steel rose to 3,061 CNY/T on October 23, 2025, up 0.33% from the previous day
summary: Steel prices increased slightly by 0.33% to 3,061 CNY per ton on October 23, 2025. Despite this short-term rise, steel prices have fallen 0.81% over the past month and are down 4.88% compared to the same time last year. Analysts expect steel prices to trade at around 3,009 Yuan/MT by the end of this quarter and forecast a decline to 2,876 Yuan/MT in 12 months.

title: 2Q 2025 Cost Report: As Steel, Aluminum Tariffs Rise to 50%, Feds OK US Steel Sale to Nippon Steel
summary: The U.S. government has increased tariffs on steel and aluminum imports to 50%, aiming to curb surges of Chinese steel exports. The American Iron and Steel Institute supports the tariff hike amid growing global steel overcapacity. Meanwhile, Nippon Steel's planned acquisition of U.S. Steel could restart significant blast furnace capacity, potentially tempering steel prices despite the tariff environment.

title: Nucor raises prices for thick-gauge rolled steel by $60/t starting in November
summary: Nucor announced a price increase of $60 per ton for thick-gauge rolled steel products effective November 2025. The new theoretical price for standard thickness A36 base rolled products is estimated to be around $1,335 per ton, reflecting ongoing adjustments in steel pricing amid market dynamics.

title: Poland's Cognor commissions new high-tech rolling mill in Siemianowice Śląskie
summary: Polish steelmaker Cognor Group has completed the construction of a new hot rolling mill for bars and sections in Siemianowice Śląskie, Poland. The mill began production and is designed to deliver an annual output of about 450,000 mt of steel products. It incorporates automation, robotics, and AI-based process control to enhance productivity and product quality.

title: EU steel and automotive industries urge pragmatic transition
summary: The European Automobile Manufacturers’ Association (ACEA) and the European Steel Association (EUROFER) issued a joint statement calling for a realistic transition to maintain production and investment in Europe. Both industries face challenges like global steel overcapacity and high energy costs. They urge EU leaders to establish a framework that safeguards employment and competitiveness.

title: Breakthrough technologies at the International Steel Week
summary: The International Steel Week will feature breakthrough technologies in steel production, focusing on green steel, energy transition, digitalization, and strategic innovation. Fives will showcase its technologies to help steelmakers innovate, decarbonize, and digitalize their plants.

title: Peru's Tía María Copper Mine Project Approved, LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Higher Overnight
summary: Peru's Tía María copper mine project has been approved, marking a significant development in the country's mining sector. LME copper prices fluctuated overnight, closing at $10,658.5/mt, a gain of 0.59%. The project's approval is expected to boost investor confidence in Peru's mining environment.

title: Comex Copper Settles 0.63% Higher at $4.9610
summary: Comex copper for October delivery rose by 3.10 cents per pound to $4.9610, marking a 0.63% increase. This rise comes after copper prices have been volatile, with significant gains over the past year. The price remains below its recent record highs.

title: Copper Price Update
summary: Copper prices rose to $4.97 per pound on October 23, 2025, reflecting a slight increase from the previous day. Over the past month, copper has seen a significant price rise of about 4.65%. Analysts expect copper to reach $5.08 per pound by the end of the quarter.

title: Peru's Tía María Copper Mine Project Approved, LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Higher Overnight [SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: The Peruvian government approved the Tía María copper mine project in the Arequipa region, with an investment of about $1.8 billion. The project, delayed since 2011 due to social and environmental issues, is expected to start production in 2027 with an annual output of approximately 120,000 metric tons of copper. This approval is seen as a positive signal to boost investor confidence in Peru's mining sector.

title: 2025 Copper Supply Crisis: Disruptions Soar as Major Mines Cut or Halt Production
summary: Copper mine supply disruptions surged in 2025 with major mines like Grasberg in Indonesia and Quebrada Blanca in Chile reducing or suspending production. Grasberg's 2025 copper output is projected to drop to 488,000 tonnes from an earlier estimate of 750,000 tonnes due to a tailings leak accident. Teck Resources also lowered production guidance for Quebrada Blanca and Highland Valley Copper due to ongoing tailings dam work and declining ore grades.

title: Angola's First Major Copper Mine Starts Production
summary: Angola's Tetelo copper mine, valued at $250 million and owned by China's Shining Star Icarus, is set to begin production, producing around 25,000 metric tons of copper concentrate annually in its first two years. The mine will start as an open-pit operation, transitioning to underground mining in the second half of 2026. This marks a significant step for Angola in diversifying its economy beyond oil and entering the clean energy minerals market.

title: Angola expands beyond oil as first copper mine starts production
summary: Angola's Tetelo copper mine is about to commence production, aiming to diversify the economy beyond oil. The $250 million project is expected to produce 25,000 metric tons of copper concentrate annually during its first two years, starting with open-pit mining and moving underground in late 2026. This development highlights Angola's ambition to attract investment in critical minerals essential for renewable energy technologies.

title: Highly encouraging mineralised indicators as Phase 1 drilling nears the Southern Porphyry’s main target at Llahuin
summary: Southern Hemisphere Mining reports promising mineralised indicators in Phase 1 drilling at the Llahuin Copper Gold Project in Chile. Shallow epithermal veins with up to 1.7% copper and porphyry indicators have been intersected, confirming the presence of mineralised veins near the main target. The drilling is progressing beyond 800 meters downhole, approaching the primary porphyry target.

title: AI Boom Pushes Copper Toward a Supply Crunch, BNEF Warns
summary: A BloombergNEF report highlights that the AI boom is increasing copper demand, potentially leading to a supply crunch. This surge in demand, combined with energy transition projects and fragile mine supply, puts pressure on the copper market. Prices could reach $13,500 per tonne by 2028.

title: Data Centers Are Helping Drive a Surge in Copper Demand
summary: The boom in data centers is driving up copper demand, contributing to supply shortages. This increased demand is part of a broader trend where copper is essential for electrification and digital infrastructure. The data center industry's growth exacerbates existing supply chain challenges.

title: Nickel Prices Remain Stable Amid Market Trends
summary: The SMM #1 refined nickel price was reported at 120,800-123,500 yuan/mt with an average of 122,150 yuan/mt, showing a slight increase from the previous day. Nickel prices have been trending within a stable range recently. Global market dynamics, including supply and demand factors, continue to influence nickel prices.

title: Nickel Sulphate Prices Remain Stable
summary: The SMM battery-grade nickel sulphate index price was stable at 28,439 yuan/mt. This reflects ongoing stability in the nickel sulphate market, which is crucial for battery production. The stable pricing suggests consistent demand and supply conditions.

title: Germany Halts Commemorative Silver Coin Production Amid Soaring Silver Prices
summary: Germany has halted the production of commemorative silver coins due to soaring silver prices. This decision reflects the increasing value of precious metals and their impact on numismatic markets. Although not directly related to nickel, it highlights broader trends in precious metals.

title: Central Omega (DKFT) Achieves Nickel Ore Production of 2.07 Million Tons Through Q3 2025
summary: Central Omega (DKFT) has reported nickel ore production of 2.07 million tons through the third quarter of 2025, highlighting continued strong output from Indonesian nickel operations.

title: PE eyes BHP's Nickel West as China tightens rare earth grip
summary: Private equity firms are showing interest in BHP's Nickel West assets in Australia as nickel prices have halved over three years due to a flood of low-cost Indonesian production, much of it under Chinese control. BHP's Nickel West has been running at a loss and is now up for sale, with potential buyers eyeing a piecemeal acquisition.

title: FPX Nickel Provides Update on Fall 2025 Community Open House Events
summary: FPX Nickel Corp. is hosting community open houses for its Baptiste Nickel Project in British Columbia, a large-scale, low-carbon nickel project with the potential to be one of the world's lowest carbon-intensive nickel producers. The project is notable for its sulphur-free, high-grade awaruite mineralization and has been recognized by the Province of British Columbia as a critical minerals initiative.

title: Copper Nickel Mining: 2026 Innovations For Sustainable Growth
summary: Copper and nickel mining innovations for 2025–2026 focus on enhancing sustainability and efficiency. Key technologies include autonomous mining equipment, water recycling systems, bioleaching, AI-driven ore sorting, blockchain traceability, and renewable energy integration, all contributing to reduced emissions, energy savings, and responsible sourcing.

title: SK On's answer to China's battery sector ascent: high-nickel, high-voltage
summary: SK On is advancing its high-nickel cathode technology to improve fast-charging capability, cycle life, and system safety in electric vehicle batteries. This innovation aims to compete with China's battery sector by enhancing performance through high-nickel content and high-voltage designs.

title: US-Australia Critical Minerals Deal: Strategic Impact
summary: The US-Australia partnership targets critical minerals including nickel to reduce supply chain vulnerabilities and support advanced manufacturing, renewable energy, and defense. The deal emphasizes accelerating lithium, cobalt, and nickel projects to secure battery material supplies essential for electric vehicles and energy storage.

title: Australian battery innovation receives $25M boost from ARENA
summary: The Australian Renewable Energy Agency (ARENA) awarded $25 million to Relectrify to commercialize its AC1 battery energy storage system, which delivers alternating current directly from battery cells without a separate inverter. This technology reduces battery degradation and improves energy delivery efficiency, supporting sustainable energy storage solutions.

title: Botswana Mining Diversification: Key Minerals & Strategy
summary: Botswana is pursuing sustainable mining diversification with a focus on critical minerals like nickel, emphasizing environmentally friendly processing and maximizing resource recovery. The strategy aims to foster long-term economic sustainability, community participation, and technological innovation to position Botswana as a leader in responsible mining.

title: Prysmian Awarded The Italy-Tunisia Interconnection
summary: Prysmian has been awarded the tender by Terna S.p.A. and STEG for the construction of the submarine power interconnection between Italy and Tunisia under the Elmed Project. The contract could reach a value of around €460 million and involves laying a power line between Sicily and Tunisia at depths up to 800 meters. This project aims to enhance energy security between Europe and Africa and supports the shift toward cleaner energy.
